channel.title: Run.bat issues
channel.description:
I've recently purchased a VPS and installed dropbox on it. I went to run the source and when I do, I get a folder that opens with the url "C:\WINDOWS\java"
My run.bat file looks like this [code]@echo off title server start java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server[/code]
Video: [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=czBjCAwOt4Y&feature=youtu.be[/youtube]

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:10, topic:447940”] @echo off title server "C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server pause

If there’s an error, let me know what it is, or try this:

@echo off
title server
"C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server.Server
pause

Also make sure you’ve compiled.[/quote]

Thanks sooo much Fridder! I owe you big time! The first one worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

@echo off
title server
"C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server
pause

If there’s an error, let me know what it is, or try this:

@echo off
title server
"C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server.Server
pause

Also make sure you’ve compiled.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

[quote=“Shadowspkin, post:7, topic:447940”]fp You just have the location for the Java to the actual java file… other wise go more into detail depending on ur Java type you have downloaded

EG: "C:/Program Files/java/jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx1300m -cp deps/data/CompiledFiles;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server

recommend not using this one that I posted your MYSQL or class files might be located in different places but in the begging you can see “C:/Program Files/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe” your just placing it to the java file… your not locating the actual java loader.[/quote]
I put in my directory for java.exe and I get this:

Error: Could not find or load main class server.Server Press any key to continue . . .

MsSummer:

if your trying to run rscalifornia the 667-711 there’s a part of the coding to prevent using a VPS i believe. you will have to disable it if that’s your problem.

I’m using a 317

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @MsSummer MsSummer
item.description:
@MsSummer wrote:

if your trying to run rscalifornia the 667-711 there’s a part of the coding to prevent using a VPS i believe. you will have to disable it if that’s your problem.

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

fp You just have the location for the Java to the actual java file… other wise go more into detail depending on ur Java type you have downloaded

EG: "C:/Program Files/java/jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx1300m -cp deps/data/CompiledFiles;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server

recommend not using this one that I posted your MYSQL or class files might be located in different places but in the begging you can see “C:/Program Files/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe” your just placing it to the java file… your not locating the actual java loader.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @LearningToCode1 LearningToCode1
item.description:
@LearningToCode1 wrote:

Right click > Open > Open with > and find > Cmd and open it with that with the pause method included in the run.bat setting’s.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

[quote=“LearningToCode1, post:4, topic:447940”]You have no pause method after your start java method… It should have a pause method after it like this

@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause[/quote]

I’ve tried pausing it, and it does nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @LearningToCode1 LearningToCode1
item.description:
@LearningToCode1 wrote:

You have no pause method after your start java method… It should have a pause method after it like this

@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat issues
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

When I double click the run.bat(via VPS), the cmd appears for only a second and a folder opens up. I added a pause to the batch file and there is no text in it whatsoever. The odd bit is, is that the run.bat file works fine when I run it from my computer.

I can probably take a video of it if you want

Read full topic
